title: How to Slow Cook Taco Filling

steps.headline: Mix the chicken broth and taco seasoning.
steps.description: To start, mix the chicken broth and taco seasoning in a large bowl. Use a spoon to blend the ingredients until you have a uniform, even mixture.

steps.headline: Add your ingredients to the slow cooker.
steps.description: First, add your chicken to the slow cooker. Then, drizzle the broth and taco seasoning mixture over the chicken. Make sure to coat the chicken evenly with the mixture.

steps.headline: Allow the ingredients to cook until done.
steps.description: Cover the slow cooker. Cook the chicken for six to eight hours on low heat. When the chicken is cooked, you can enjoy your taco filling with tortillas and any fillings, such as lettuce and tomato, that you want.

steps.headline: Wash your cooking station carefully.
steps.description: You wan to take precautions when working with raw meat. Wash all the utensils used to handle the chicken in warm, soapy water. You should also wipe down any surfaces in warm, soapy water. You should wash your hands afterwards as well. Use warm water and soap and wash them for about 20 seconds.

steps.headline: Whisk together the spices.
steps.description: To start, place your chili powder, paprika, and cumin in a bowl. Use a wire whisk or fork to blend these ingredients together. Keep blending until all the spices are mixed evenly.

steps.headline: Add your spices to the beef.
steps.description: Do this prior to cooking the beef. Place the beef in mixing bowl and sprinkle the mixture over the beef. Use a spoon to mix everything together, until the meat is evenly coated in the spices.

steps.headline: Cook your beef.
steps.description: Add one tablespoon of the olive oil to the skillet it. Allow it to heat up slightly before adding your beef mixture. Then, cook your beef until it's browned on both sides. As you'll be cooking your beef in the slow cooker, you do not need to cook it through completely. You should only cook the beef for about two minutes on each side until it's just brown.

steps.headline: Saute the onions and garlic.
steps.description: Add the other tablespoon of olive oil to the pan with your meat. Then, add the onions to the mixture. Cook everything for about three more minutes. After three minutes have passed, add your garlic. Cook everything for another minute.

steps.headline: Mix the beef stock, minced chipotle, and tomato paste with your onions.
steps.description: Mix the beef stock to the beef mixture and mix everything together. Then, add the minced chipotle and tomato paste. Whisk everything together and bring your sauce to a boil. Then, simmer everything for about three minutes or until your mixture has thickened.

steps.headline: Cook all your ingredients in the slow cooker.
steps.description: Add the full mixture to your slow cooker. You can cook your ingredients on low for six to eight hours or on high for three to four hours. When the beef shreds easily, your filling is complete.

methods.name: Making Quinoa and Black Bean Filling

steps.headline: Add your ingredients to the slow cooker.
steps.description: Use a one and a half to two quart slow cooker. Add all your ingredients and mix them together until you have an even mixture. The order you add the ingredients is not important.

steps.headline: Cook your filling.
steps.description: Turn your slow cooker to the low setting. Allow your mixture to cook on low for seven to eight hours before serving.

steps.headline: Add salt and pepper to taste.
steps.description: Mix in a small amount of salt and pepper. Add enough that the flavors in your mixture are distinct. Add small amounts of salt and pepper at a time, tasting as you go, until you reach your desired taste.

text: Making Chicken Filling Mix the chicken broth and taco seasoning. To start, mix the chicken broth and taco seasoning in a large bowl. Use a spoon to blend the ingredients until you have a uniform, even mixture. Add your ingredients to the slow cooker. First, add your chicken to the slow cooker. Then, drizzle the broth and taco seasoning mixture over the chicken. Make sure to coat the chicken evenly with the mixture. Allow the ingredients to cook until done. Cover the slow cooker. Cook the chicken for six to eight hours on low heat. When the chicken is cooked, you can enjoy your taco filling with tortillas and any fillings, such as lettuce and tomato, that you want. Wash your cooking station carefully. You wan to take precautions when working with raw meat. Wash all the utensils used to handle the chicken in warm, soapy water. You should also wipe down any surfaces in warm, soapy water. You should wash your hands afterwards as well. Use warm water and soap and wash them for about 20 seconds. Making Beef Filling Whisk together the spices. To start, place your chili powder, paprika, and cumin in a bowl. Use a wire whisk or fork to blend these ingredients together. Keep blending until all the spices are mixed evenly. Add your spices to the beef. Do this prior to cooking the beef. Place the beef in mixing bowl and sprinkle the mixture over the beef. Use a spoon to mix everything together, until the meat is evenly coated in the spices. Cook your beef. Add one tablespoon of the olive oil to the skillet it. Allow it to heat up slightly before adding your beef mixture. Then, cook your beef until it's browned on both sides. As you'll be cooking your beef in the slow cooker, you do not need to cook it through completely. You should only cook the beef for about two minutes on each side until it's just brown. Saute the onions and garlic. Add the other tablespoon of olive oil to the pan with your meat. Then, add the onions to the mixture. Cook everything for about three more minutes. After three minutes have passed, add your garlic. Cook everything for another minute. Mix the beef stock, minced chipotle, and tomato paste with your onions. Mix the beef stock to the beef mixture and mix everything together. Then, add the minced chipotle and tomato paste. Whisk everything together and bring your sauce to a boil. Then, simmer everything for about three minutes or until your mixture has thickened. Cook all your ingredients in the slow cooker. Add the full mixture to your slow cooker. You can cook your ingredients on low for six to eight hours or on high for three to four hours. When the beef shreds easily, your filling is complete. Making Quinoa and Black Bean Filling Add your ingredients to the slow cooker. Use a one and a half to two quart slow cooker. Add all your ingredients and mix them together until you have an even mixture. The order you add the ingredients is not important. Cook your filling. Turn your slow cooker to the low setting. Allow your mixture to cook on low for seven to eight hours before serving. Add salt and pepper to taste. Mix in a small amount of salt and pepper. Add enough that the flavors in your mixture are distinct. Add small amounts of salt and pepper at a time, tasting as you go, until you reach your desired taste.
